intro: Barleriola multiflora, commonly known as the many-flowered barleriopsis, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun. Its small, white to pale yellow flowers are arranged in dense clusters, making it an ornamental plant in gardens. Barleriola multiflora is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
